definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
Pathfinder, NASA spacecraft sent to Mars in 1977

sentences.english: The spacecraft also contained a communications task that ran with medium priority.
sentences.chinese: 另外探路者号上还有一个中优先级的通信进程。

sentences.english: Thee trilobite can clean a room on its own, using sound waves to feel its way around.
sentences.chinese: 三叶虫可以利用声波探路，从而自己打扫房间。

sentences.english: So the government should subsidise pioneers who break a path for others.
sentences.chinese: 所以政府应补贴为后来者探路的行业先锋企业。

sentences.english: The Trilobite can clean a room on its own, using sound waves to feel its way around.
sentences.chinese: “三叶虫”可以利用声波探路，从而自己打扫房间。

sentences.english: Keep the object selected and open the Pathfinder Palette.
sentences.chinese: 保持对象的选定，并打开探路者的调色盘。

sentences.english: Yes, nothing dangerous, brother monkey is ahead.
sentences.chinese: 没事的，猴哥在前面探路。

sentences.english: He became expert at feeling for it in the morass with his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他成了专家，能用脚在沼泽里探路。

sentences.english: Yes, yes, brother monkey will explore the way.
sentences.chinese: 没事的，猴哥在前面探路。

sentences.english: Jim went to explore while Tom unpacked the food.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆前去探路，汤姆打开了食物。

sentences.english: As soon as the spacecraft landed, the Pathfinder went to work.
sentences.chinese: 甫一着陆，探路者立即展开工作。

sentences.english: Troops line got to, the Japanese officer sent a subordinate units.
sentences.chinese: 部队行到半道，日军军官派出一个部下探路。

sentences.english: As it turns out, the United States is not the only path-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 结果是，美国不仅仅是一个探路者。

definition: to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to set out in advance to make arrangements (board, lodging etc)/(military) to dispatch an advance party
to investigate/to observe/to scout/to seek out and examine/to explore
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to examine/to probe/to scout out/to nose around
to provide support/to come to the rescue
